Authors:
Kenichi Nonaka, Taichi Kaneta, Satoshi Omura, Rokuro
Masuma
Title:
Mariannaea macrochlamydospora, a new hyphomycete
(Nectriaceae) from soils in the Bonin Islands, Japan
Keywords:
Anamorph Â· New species Â· Oceanic island Â· Phylogeny Â·
Soil-inhabiting fungi
Abstract:
Mariannaea macrochlamydospora, a new hyphomycete
classified in the Nectriaceae (Ascomycota) was isolated from soils in
the Bonin Islands, Japan. It is characterized by yellow to brownish
colony, verticillate conidiophore and imbricate chains of fusiform
conidia. Morphologically, the species is similar to M. elegans, M.
aquaticola and M samuelsii, but it is different from them in phylogeny
and also differs with conida or phialides morphology and productivity
and size of chlamydospores.
